channel.title: appveyor on Anton Sizikov
channel.description: Recent content in appveyor on Anton Sizikov

item.title: CatLight
item.description: It’s hard to imagine modern development without continuous intergation and unit-tests. At work I hardly pay attention on the process, it just works: I push code to GitHub, later on TeamCity picks up changes and starts the build, and few minutes after I receive Slack or email notification about the result. However for my personal projects things are different. I’m using free plan on AppVeyor. It works pretty well except the fact that your build might stay in the queue for a while.

item.title: Fully automated Continuous Integration for your Open Source library for free
item.description: This is a long title. Well, the post is going to be long as well. I want to show how you can set up the CI pipeline using free services and tools. GitHub GitVersion AppVeyor As an example I’m going to use my pet project: AsyncSuffix plugin for ReSharper. The reason is that the way you pack and publish R# extensions is slightly different from the regular NuGet package.
